title: Isolation

title: Absolute Value Inequality
text: For an algebraic expression X, and $$k>0$$, an absolute value inequality is an inequality of the form $$|X| \geq k$$ is equivalent to $$X \leq -k$$ or $$X \geq k$$
speech: For an algebraic expression X, and  k is greater than 0 , an absolute value inequality is an inequality of the form  determinant of   x is greater than or equal to k  is equivalent to    x, is less than or equal to negative k  or    x is greater than or equal to k

or     x is greater than or equal to k

title: Interval Notation
text: $$(-\infty,b]$$ represents all real numbers less than $$b$$, including $$b$$, and $$[a,\infty)srepresent$$ all real numbers greater than a, including a.
